title.@value: Light and heavy chain deposition disease

definition.@value: A disease of the kidney, caused by proliferation and deposition of pieces of truncated or abnormal light and heavy chain segments of white blood cells. This disease is characterised by fibrillar or granular tissue deposits and renal dysfunction, which may lead to organ failure. Confirmation is by identification of light and heavy chain deposition tissue biopsy under a microscope.

label.@value: Light and heavy chain deposition disease
